titleStmt.title: George W. Anderson vs. John H. McGraw. Application for Habeas Corpus

bibl.title: George W. Anderson vs. John H. McGraw. Application for Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Writ of habeas corpus may be granted directed to the said John H. McGraw, commadning him to have the body of your petitioner before your honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your honor commanding him, together with the time and cause of your petitioner's detention and said writ; and that he may be returned to his liberty. George W. Anderson

Territory of Washington County of King ss George W. Anderson, bring forth duly sworn, according to law, when his oath deprives and say: that he is the is the petitioner named in the forgiving petition, that he has read the law, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true George W. Anderson
Sworn and subscribed before me this 1st day of October A. D. 1889 Thomas R. Hardin. Notary public in and for King County Washington Territory
